abstract: A property for accessing a Markdown source position attribute.
overview:
## Discussion

This attribute indicates the position in the Markdown source where a run of attributed text begins and ends, omitting markup characters in the source. For example, after parsing the source string `“This is *emphasized*.”`, the text `emphasized` has a Markdown source position that starts at column `10`. This index is the `“e”` character, not the `“*”` formatting character.

An attributed string parsed from Markdown text includes this attribute only if the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString/MarkdownParsingOptions/appliesSourcePositionAttributes] value in the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString/MarkdownParsingOptions] provided to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString] initializer is `true`.

In the following example, the `markdown` source string contains several forms of Markdown formatting supported by AttributedString, including the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/InlinePresentationIntent/stronglyEmphasized] inline presentation intent applied with double asterisks. The example parses the source string, enabling the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString/MarkdownParsingOptions/appliesSourcePositionAttributes] option. Next, the example loops over the attributed string’s runs, looking for a run that contains both a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributeScopes/FoundationAttributes/markdownSourcePosition] attribute and an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributeScopes/FoundationAttributes/inlinePresentationIntent] whose value is [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/InlinePresentationIntent/stronglyEmphasized]. If it finds such a run, it prints the source position attribute and the attributed text.

This uses the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Range] convenience initializer [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Range/init(_:in:)-9vre5], which creates a range from an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString/MarkdownSourcePosition] and the Markdown source string. Working with a range may be more convenient than working with the start and end position properties in [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString/MarkdownSourcePosition].

items.description: A type for using a markdown source position as an attribute.
items.name: AttributeScopes.FoundationAttributes.MarkdownSourcePositionAttribute

title: markdownSourcePosition
